articles.description: Listen to Sportsound commentary as Aberdeen face BK Hacken in the first leg of their Europa League play-off, before watching live as Hearts host Greek side PAOK.
articles.title: Europa League: Aberdeen in Gothenburg to face BK Hacken

articles.description: Watch live coverage of the World Athletics Championships in Budapest, with five gold medals to be won on day six.
articles.title: World Athletics Championships: Five gold medals to be won - watch & text

articles.description: Britain's Matthew Hudson-Smith claims 400m silver at the World Championships as he finishes 0.09 seconds behind Antonio Watson.
articles.title: GB's Hudson-Smith claims 400m silver as Watson wins

articles.description: Manchester City complete the £55.4m signing of Belgium winger Jeremy Doku from Rennes on a five-year contract.
articles.title: Man City sign winger Doku from Rennes for £55.4m

articles.description: Birmingham Phoenix beat London Spirit by 77 runs as The Hundred group stages come to an end.
articles.title: Phoenix crush Spirit to end Hundred group stage

articles.description: Aberdeen come from two goals down to earn a sensational draw against Swedish champions Hacken in the Europa League play-off and reignite their chances of reaching the group stages.
articles.title: Aberdeen recover from two down to draw with Hacken

articles.description: Watch as a spectator takes a tumble over the railings while attempting to take a catch during The Hundred match between Birmingham Phoenix and London Spirit at Edgbaston.
articles.title: Fan falls over railings attempting catch at Edgbaston

articles.description: England wing Anthony Watson is ruled out of the Rugby World Cup with a calf injury.
articles.title: England wing Watson out of World Cup with injury

articles.description: Britain's Andy Murray will play France's Corentin Moutet in the US Open first round as he starts his latest bid to go deep at a Grand Slam.
articles.title: Murray faces France's Moutet in US Open

articles.description: Sportswear brand Nike will sell Women's World Cup goalkeeper tops after Mary Earps complaints.
articles.title: Earps gets her way as Nike makes keeper shirts U-turn
